The two issued a 7″ on Jugoton in 1976, followed by the 1977 RTV Ljubljana release Stižemo, recorded with guitarist/bassist Zlatko Hold. data.text:
Laza i Ipe were a Yugoslav symphonic/electronic duo comprised of keyboardist/composer Laza Ristovski and drummer/vocalist Ipe Ivandić, both of Bijelo Dugme. The two issued a 7″ on Jugoton in 1976, followed by the 1977 RTV Ljubljana release Stižemo, recorded with guitarist/bassist Zlatko Hold.

Members: Laza Ristovski (Piano, Organ [Hammond C-3], Synthesizer [Arp Odyssey, Polymoog, Arp String], Electric Piano [Wurlitzer], Mellotron [400], Acoustic Guitar), Ipe Ivandić (Drums, Percussion, Vocals)

Discography:
